column4: Description of Business item
column5: Textual description of the business item- Long form description

column4: AWS is listed as a group of similar products and services with net sales reported for 2022, 2023, and 2024.
column5: AWS is included in Amazon's net sales breakdown by groups of similar products and services, which also have similar economic characteristics. The net sales for AWS are reported as $80,096 million in 2022, $90,757 million in 2023, and $107,556 million in 2024.

column4: Advertising services are a group of similar products and services with similar economic characteristics.
column5: Advertising services are reported as a distinct group in Amazon's net sales, reflecting products and services with similar economic characteristics. The segment includes offerings such as sponsored ads, display, and video advertising. Net sales for Advertising services were $37,739 million in 2022, $46,906 million in 2023, and $56,214 million in 2024.

column4: Net sales for Online stores are reported as a group of similar products and services.
column5: Net sales by groups of similar products and services, which also have similar economic characteristics, is as follows: Online stores generated $220,004 million in 2022, $231,872 million in 2023, and $247,029 million in 2024. These figures represent the performance of the Online stores segment.

column4: Physical stores is a group of similar products and services with net sales reported separately.
column5: Physical stores is listed as a distinct group of similar products and services by Amazon, with net sales figures provided for the years 2022, 2023, and 2024. The segment is reported alongside other major business lines such as Online stores, Third-party seller services, and AWS.

column4: Includes annual and monthly fees associated with Amazon Prime memberships.
column5: Amazon Prime is a subscription service for which Amazon collects annual and monthly fees. The service is included in the company's subscription services segment, along with other digital offerings.

column4: Digital video is included as part of Amazon's non-AWS subscription services.
column5: Digital video is one of the subscription services offered by Amazon, alongside other digital content such as audiobooks, digital music, and e-books. These services contribute to the company's subscription services revenue.

column4: Audiobook subscriptions are part of Amazon's non-AWS subscription services.
column5: Audiobook is a digital content subscription service offered by Amazon. It is grouped with other digital services such as digital video, digital music, and e-books in the subscription services segment.

column4: Digital music is included in Amazon's non-AWS subscription services.
column5: Digital music is a subscription service offered by Amazon, contributing to the company's subscription services revenue. It is listed alongside digital video, audiobooks, and e-books.

column4: E-book subscriptions are part of Amazon's non-AWS subscription services.
column5: E-book is a digital content subscription service offered by Amazon. It is included in the subscription services segment, along with digital video, audiobooks, and digital music.

column4: Net sales for Third-party seller services are reported for the years 2022, 2023, and 2024.
column5: Third-party seller services is a group of similar products and services with similar economic characteristics. Net sales for Third-party seller services were $117,716 million in 2022, $140,053 million in 2023, and $156,146 million in 2024.

column4: We report financial results for two segments: Family of Apps (FoA) and Reality Labs (RL).
column5: We report financial results for two segments: Family of Apps (FoA) and Reality Labs (RL). Currently, we generate substantially all of our revenue from selling advertising placements on our family of apps to marketers, which is reflected in FoA.

column4: We report financial results for two segments: Family of Apps (FoA) and Reality Labs (RL).
column5: We report financial results for two segments: Family of Apps (FoA) and Reality Labs (RL). Currently, we generate substantially all of our revenue from selling advertising placements on our family of apps to marketers, which is reflected in FoA.

column4: We report financial results for two segments: Family of Apps (FoA) and Reality Labs (RL).
column5: We report financial results for two segments: Family of Apps (FoA) and Reality Labs (RL). Currently, we generate substantially all of our revenue from selling advertising placements on our family of apps to marketers, which is reflected in FoA.

column4: The GPU was initially used to simulate human imagination, enabling the virtual worlds of video games and films.
column5: The GPU was initially used to simulate human imagination, enabling the virtual worlds of video games and films. Today, it also simulates human intelligence, enabling a deeper understanding of the physical world. Its parallel processing capabilities, supported by thousands of computing cores, are essential for deep learning algorithms.

column4: With our introduction of the CUDA programming model in 2006, we opened the parallel processing capabilities of our GPU to a broad range of compute-intensive applications.
column5: With our introduction of the CUDA programming model in 2006, we opened the parallel processing capabilities of our GPU to a broad range of compute-intensive applications, paving the way for new uses in modern computing.

column4: Compute & Networking is a reportable segment with significant revenue growth.
column5: Compute & Networking is one of NVIDIA's reportable segments, showing a substantial increase in revenue year over year. The segment's revenue grew from $47,405 million to $116,193 million, representing a 145% increase.

column4: Graphics is a reportable segment with revenue and operating income reported for the years ended Jan 26, 2025 and Jan 28, 2024.
column5: Graphics is one of NVIDIA's reportable segments. The segment generated $14,304 million in revenue for the year ended Jan 26, 2025, compared to $13,517 million for the previous year, with a 6% increase. Operating income for the segment was $5,085 million in 2025, down from $5,846 million in 2024.

column4: Mac net sales increased during 2025 compared to 2024.
column5: Mac net sales increased during 2025 compared to 2024. The table shows Mac net sales were $33,708 million in 2025, up 12% from $29,984 million in 2024 and $29,357 million in 2023.

column4: Services net sales increased during 2025 compared to 2024.
column5: Services net sales increased during 2025 compared to 2024, contributing to overall net sales growth in Japan and the Rest of Asia Pacific. The table shows Services net sales were $109,158 million in 2025, up 14% from 2024.

column4: Wearables, Home and Accessories net sales were $35,686 million in 2025, a 4% decrease from 2024.
column5: Wearables, Home and Accessories is a reported net sales category for Apple Inc. In 2025, net sales for this segment were $35,686 million, representing a 4% decrease compared to 2024, when net sales were $37,005 million.

column4: iPad net sales increased during 2025 compared to 2024.
column5: Japan net sales increased during 2025 compared to 2024 primarily due to higher net sales of iPhone, Services and iPad. The table shows iPad net sales were $28,023 million in 2025, a 5% increase from 2024.

column4: iPhone net sales increased in 2025 compared to 2024 in multiple regions.
column5: iPhone is a key product for Apple Inc., with net sales increasing in 2025 compared to 2024 in Japan and the Rest of Asia Pacific. The 2025 Form 10-K shows iPhone sales of $209,586 million, a 4% increase from the previous year.

column4: Windows OEM revenue is impacted significantly by the number of Windows operating system licenses purchased by OEMs, which they pre-install on the devices they sell.
column5: Windows OEM revenue is impacted significantly by the number of Windows operating system licenses purchased by OEMs, which they pre-install on the devices they sell. In addition to computing device market volume, Windows OEM revenue is impacted by several factors including device mix, market demand, and pricing changes.

column4: Surface is designed to help organizations, students, and consumers be more productive.
column5: We design and sell devices, such as Surface (including Copilot+ PCs) and PC accessories. Surface is designed to help organizations, students, and consumers be more productive.

column4: Xbox Game Pass is a subscription service and gaming community with access to a curated library of first- and third-party titles.
column5: These unique gaming experiences are the cornerstone of Xbox Game Pass, a subscription service and gaming community with access to a curated library of first- and third-party titles. The gamer remains at the heart of the Xbox ecosystem.

column4: Our Microsoft Edge browser and Bing search engine with Copilot are key tools to enable user acquisition and engagement.
column5: Our Microsoft Edge browser and Bing search engine with Copilot are key tools to enable user acquisition and engagement, while our technology platform enables accelerated delivery of digital advertising solutions.

column4: Microsoft Copilot is a digital companion designed to inform, entertain, and inspire.
column5: Microsoft Copilot is a digital companion designed to inform, entertain, and inspire. Our Microsoft Edge browser and Bing search engine with Copilot are key tools to enable user acquisition and engagement.

column4: Our Microsoft Edge browser and Bing search engine with Copilot are key tools to enable user acquisition and engagement.
column5: Our Microsoft Edge browser and Bing search engine with Copilot are key tools to enable user acquisition and engagement, while our technology platform enables accelerated delivery of digital advertising solutions.

column3: Microsoft 365 Commercial products and cloud services
column4: Microsoft 365 Commercial products and cloud services include Microsoft 365 Commercial cloud, comprising Microsoft 365 Commercial, Enterprise Mobility + Security, and other services.
column5: Microsoft 365 Commercial products and cloud services include Microsoft 365 Commercial cloud, comprising Microsoft 365 Commercial, Enterprise Mobility + Security, the cloud portion of Windows Commercial, the per-user portion of Power BI, Exchange, SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft 365 Security and Compliance, and Microsoft 365 Copilot; and Microsoft 365 Commercial products, comprising Windows Commercial on-premises and Office licensed on-premises.

column3: Microsoft 365 Consumer products and cloud services
column4: Microsoft 365 Consumer products and cloud services include Microsoft 365 Consumer subscriptions, Office licensed on-premises, and other consumer services.
column5: Microsoft 365 Consumer products and cloud services include Microsoft 365 Consumer subscriptions, Office licensed on-premises, and other consumer services. Growth depends on our ability to reach new users, add value to our core product set with new features including AI tools, and continue to expand our product and service offerings into new markets.

column4: LinkedIn connects the world’s professionals to make them more productive and successful and transforms the way companies hire, market, sell, and learn.
column5: LinkedIn connects the world’s professionals to make them more productive and successful and transforms the way companies hire, market, sell, and learn. In addition to LinkedIn’s free services, LinkedIn offers monetized solutions designed to offer AI-enabled insights and productivity: Talent Solutions, Marketing Solutions, Premium Subscriptions, and Sales Solutions.

column4: Dynamics provides cloud-based and on-premises business solutions for financial management, ERP, CRM, and supply chain management.
column5: Dynamics provides cloud-based and on-premises business solutions for financial management, enterprise resource planning (“ERP”), customer relationship management (“CRM”), and supply chain management, as well as agentic AI and other low code application development platforms, for small and medium businesses, large organizations, and divisions of global enterprises.

column4: We report our segment results as Google Services, Google Cloud, and Other Bets.
column5: We report our segment results as Google Services, Google Cloud, and Other Bets. Additionally, certain costs are not allocated to our segments because they represent Alphabet-level activities.

column4: We report our segment results as Google Services, Google Cloud, and Other Bets.
column5: We report our segment results as Google Services, Google Cloud, and Other Bets. The following table presents segment operating income (loss) (in millions), including a line for Other Bets. Additionally, certain costs are not allocated to our segments because they represent Alphabet-level activities.
